alert.note: Alert for Nueces (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 02 at 4:50PM CDT until October 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south Texas, including the following county, Nueces. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Corpus Christi Bay and Oso Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Corpus Christi, La Palmera Mall, Corpus Christi Country Club, Spohn Hospital South, Bay Area Medical Center, Driscoll Childrens Hospital, Texas A&M University Corpus Christi, Cole Park, Cabaniss Field, Del Mar College Heritage Campus, Kings Crossing Subdivision, South Texas Botanical Gardens, Downtown Corpus Christi, Del Mar College Windward Campus, Flour Bluff, Waldron Field, Corpus Christi North Beach and Corpus Christi Naval Air Station. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
